trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Radioactive Soles
entries: The Radioactive Tarrasque gains 120 feet flying speed at its turn's start. When flying, its takeoff ignites a 30ft radius in radioactive flames, causing {@damage 15d4} fire damage and {@damage 10d4} poison damage to creatures failing a {@dc 20} Dexterity save. Its landing mimics a meteor slam within a 30ft radius, dealing {@damage 15d6} bludgeoning damage to creatures failing the same save, as it impacts the ground with force.

trait.name: Aura of Radioactivity
entries: 300 ft. from the Tarrasque.
{@b Radiant Burst}: At the Tarrasque's turn start, creatures within the aura must make a {@dc 20} Constitution save. On a fail, they take {@damage 10d6} radiant damage, or half on success.
{@b Necrotic Decay}: At the start of a creature's turn within the aura, they must make a {@dc 20} Constitution save. On a fail, they take {@damage 10d6} necrotic damage, or half on success.
{@b Radiation Sickness}: Failing any save by 5 or more causes one level of {@condition exhaustion}.
{@b Cumulative Exposure}: Each consecutive round within the aura increases save DCs by 1, resetting after 24 hours outside

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its radioactive Spear Generator. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage and  56 ({@damage 16d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.

If the tarrasque takes 80 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

action.name: Radioactive Spear Generator
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 200 ft., one target. {@h}42 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. If the attack roll exceeds the target's AC by 5 or more, the target suffers Radiation Poisoning, gaining disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws for 1 minute. A creature can make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the Radiation Poisoning on a successful save. The spear forms from where the tail would have been, but it's been mechanically modified to produce large spears of radioactive crystal.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or Radioactive spear attack

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

The legendary tarrasque is possibly the most dreaded monster of the Material Plane. It is widely believed that only one of these creatures exists, though no one can predict where and when it will strike.

A scaly biped, the tarrasque is fifty feet tall and seventy feet long, weighing hundreds of tons. It carries itself like a bird of prey, leaning forward and using its powerful lashing tail for balance. Its cavernous maw yawns wide enough to swallow all but the largest creatures, and so great is its hunger that it can devour the populations of whole towns.

entries.name: Legendary Destruction
entries: The destructive potential of the tarrasque is so vast that some cultures incorporate the monster into religious doctrine, weaving its sporadic appearance into stories of divine judgment and wrath.

Legends tell how the tarrasque slumbers in its secret lair beneath the earth, remaining in a dormant state for decades or centuries. When it awakens in answer to some inscrutable cosmic call, it rises from the depths to obliterate everything in its path.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Astral Form
entries: This tarrasque projects a 30-foot radius portal to the Astral Sea, housing its true form. In the material plane, an immense astral tarrasque is seen ravaging its surroundings. Creatures entering or attempting to exit this 30-foot radius must make a Charisma saving throw ({@dc 22}). On a successful save, they resist being drawn into the Astral Plane or manage to escape back to the material plane. On a failure, they are either transported to the Astral Sea, where they confront the real tarrasque, or prevented from leaving this perilous zone, with their attacks capable of affecting the tarrasque directly.

trait.name: Drowning in the astral sea
entries: Within a 100-foot radius of the tarrasque, dense astral energy inflicts {@damage 8d10} bludgeoning damage to creatures at the start of its turn. {@dc 22} Constitution save required; failure by 5 or more also stuns until the next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Planar Swallow
entries: When the tarrasque successfully bites and swallows a Large or smaller creature it is grappling, the target is instantly transported to a random vortex in an elemental plane, bypassing the usual conditions of being swallowed. Upon arrival, the creature suffers 99 ({@damage 22d8}) damage from the vortex's chaotic energy before immediately reappearing outside the tarrasque's planar aura, ending the grapple.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

The legendary tarrasque is possibly the most dreaded monster of the Material Plane. It is widely believed that only one of these creatures exists, though no one can predict where and when it will strike.

A scaly biped, the tarrasque is fifty feet tall and seventy feet long, weighing hundreds of tons. It carries itself like a bird of prey, leaning forward and using its powerful lashing tail for balance. Its cavernous maw yawns wide enough to swallow all but the largest creatures, and so great is its hunger that it can devour the populations of whole towns.

entries.name: Legendary Destruction
entries: The destructive potential of the tarrasque is so vast that some cultures incorporate the monster into religious doctrine, weaving its sporadic appearance into stories of divine judgment and wrath.

Legends tell how the tarrasque slumbers in its secret lair beneath the earth, remaining in a dormant state for decades or centuries. When it awakens in answer to some inscrutable cosmic call, it rises from the depths to obliterate everything in its path.

trait.name: Corrosive Touch
entries: Any creature that touches The Void Walker or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

trait.name: Phase Through
entries: As a bonus action, The Void Walker can phase through solid objects and move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. It can remain within objects at the end of this move without harm.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Void Walker makes two attacks with its Corrosive Grasp.

action.name: Corrosive Grasp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@dice 4d8 + 4}) acid damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@dice 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns due to a corrosive wound. Any creature can take an action to wipe off the acid, ending this effect.

action.name: Pocket Dimension
entries: Recharge 5-6. The Void Walker targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or be moved through a wall.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Void Walker makes one Corrosive Grasp attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Void Walker moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Phase Through (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Void Walker uses its Phase Through ability.

trait.name: Bathed in the Styx
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of The Infinite Serpent must make a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or lose thier concentration as droplets from the styx cause it to forget.

trait.name: The Infinite Serpent
entries: Every instance of damage dealt to the infinite serpent will increase its size by 5ft and its Hitpoints increase by 20.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Infinite Serpent makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@dice 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@dice 4d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 17} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@dice 3d12 + 10}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 22 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

action.name: Forget {@recharge 5}
entries: The Infinite Serpent targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or take 55 (10d10) psychic damage and become stunned for 1 minute as their memories are drained. The last class feature it used is removed from its memory for the next 1 hour. Target can make a Wis save at the end of thier turns to try and remember.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Infinite Serpent makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The Infinite Serpent makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Muddled Thoughts (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Infinite Serpent targets one creature it can see within 60 feet, filling its mind with fleeting, confusing thoughts. The target must succeed on a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw or have their thoughts muddled. On a failed save, the target takes a -{@dice 2d6} penalty to their next {@dice d20} roll (attack roll, ability check, or saving throw) as the confusing thoughts momentarily cloud their judgement and focus.

trait.name: Chill of the Void
entries: Cold damage dealt by the void dragon ignores resistance and immunity to cold damage.

trait.name: Heat Death
entries: When the void dragon is killed it explodes in a swath of celestial destruction. Each creature and object within 1 lightyear of the dragon take 1100 ({@damage 200d10}) bludgeoning damage, 1100 ({@damage 200d10}) cold damage, and 1100 ({@damage 200d10}) psychic damage. Each damage type can be reduced by half with a successful {@dc 42} saving throw: Dexterity vs. bludgeoning, Constitution vs. cold, and Wisdom vs. psychic. Additionally, a creature that fails two or three of the saving throws is affected by a plane shift spell and sent to a random plane. If it is sent to the plane it currently occupies, it appears {@dice 5d100} miles away in a random direction.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (15/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Galaxy of Stars
entries: A void dragon is a collection of an entire galaxy of Stars. Its size is incomprehensible and any part of it can be attacked. A meteorite, an asteroid, everything within the space of the void dragon will affect it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Aura of Madness. It then makes 8 attacks: 4 toss meteors, 2 toss asteroids, 1 toss moon, 1 toss planet.

action.name: Aura of Madness
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within its space must succeed on a {@dc 42} Wisdom saving throw or become afflicted with a long term {@variantrule madness} for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Toss Meteor
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 29} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}70 ({@damage 20d6 + 15}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stellar Flare {@recharge 5}
entries: As an action, the Void Dragon opens a transient portal directly to a star's core, visible within a 150-foot radius centered on a point the dragon can see within 500 feet. Brilliant solar energy and magnetic storms pour through the portal, engulfing the area in a devastating solar flare. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 42} Dexterity saving throw.

On a failed save, a creature takes 150 ({@damage 30d10}) fire damage and 150 ({@damage 30d10}) radiant damage, and is {@condition blinded} for 1 minute. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn’t {@condition blinded}. The intense flare also ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried, and the ground becomes scorched earth, making it difficult terrain.

action.name: Toss Asteroid
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 29} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}125 ({@damage 20d10 + 15}) bludgeoning damage, plus 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Toss Moon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 29} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}210 ({@damage 30d12 + 15}) bludgeoning damage, plus 82 ({@damage 15d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Toss Planet
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 29} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}435 ({@damage 40d20 + 15}) bludgeoning damage, plus 195 ({@damage 30d12}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The angel of judgment's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The angel can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Change Face
entries: As a bonus action, the angel of judgment can change its face and demeanor to exhibit aspects of chaos or law, as needed by its assignment. It can have only one face active at a time and can end the effect on its turn as a bonus action.

items.name: Face of Chaos.
items.entry: The angel of judgment becomes a harbinger of chaos. It is treated as a fiend by spells and other magical effects that affect fiends and has advantage on attack rolls against celestials and devils.

items.name: Face of Law.
items.entry: The angel becomes a harbinger of law and has advantage on attack rolls against demons, fey, and undead.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The angel of judgment knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The angel of judgement has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Penance Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the angel of judgment's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the angel, the angel can force it to make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw if the angel isn't {@skill incapacitated} and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature is {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature is {@condition restrained}.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the angel until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the angel in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Weapons of Balance
entries: The angel of judgment's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel of judgment hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d8} force damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The angel of judgment can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Divine Retribution
entries: Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, it takes radiant damage equal to half the damage you take from the attack.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the angel of judgment fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The angel of judgment makes three attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) slashing damage plus 27 ({@damage 6d8}) force damage.
With faces of light and stern appraisal, these angels see both sides and render a verdict.
Angels of judgment are cosmic agents of balance. Unlike most angels, they exist to enforce equality between law and chaos. They prefer to solve disputes verbally but use force when prudent.

entries.name: Two-Faced
entries: Each angel of judgment bears two aspects: a dispassionate angel and a fiendish judge. When called to violence by the heavenly host or infernal legions, its dispassionate face changes to that of an avenging angel.

entries.name: Witnesses to History
entries: In times of turmoil and upheaval, angels of judgment watch over events. While observing, the angel is a stoic spectator, intervening only if it sees a threat to universal harmony. Even then, they prefer to send {@creature sammael|CCodex|sammael angels} ({@loader Creature Codex|collection/Kobold Press; Creature Codex.json}) to carry out their judgments, taking direct action only against the direst of threats.

entries.name: Cosmic Arbiters
entries: Angels of judgment arbitrate claims between the lords of righteousness and the masters of madness. If either party violates the terms, the angel destroys the offender and patiently waits for a new representative to take their place. Immortal Nature. An angel of judgment doesn't require food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Asteroid Camouflage
entries: The Asteroid Roper has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide on rocky or celestial terrain.

trait.name: Gravitational Pull
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 60 feet of the Asteroid Roper must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn as they are pulled toward the Roper.

trait.name: Starlight Regeneration
entries: The Asteroid Roper regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it is in an environment with no atmosphere (such as outer space) and not within the area of an antimagic field. If the Asteroid Roper takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the Asteroid Roper's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Asteroid Roper makes four attacks with its tendrils and one with its bite.

action.name: Devour
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}46 ({@dice 12d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 200 ft., one target. {@h}34 ({@dice 12d4 + 4}) The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the Asteroid Roper can't use the same tendril on another target.

action.name: Reel
entries: The Asteroid Roper pulls each creature {@condition grappled} by it up to 200 feet straight toward it.

action.name: Nebula Cloud
entries: The Asteroid Roper exhales a cloud of nebula-like gas in a 30-foot radius around it and moves 100ft to a new location. The area is heavily obscured for 1 minute. Any creature that starts its turn in the cloud must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, suffering disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn due to disorientation.

action.name: Stellar Absorption
entries: The Roper turns its back to the sun and reflects a concentrated beam of sunlight at in a 200ft long, 20ft wide line. The Asteroid Roper regains 100 hit points. Each creature  in the line must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 8d8} radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The Roper gains additional hit points equal to half the total damage dealt to other creatures.

legendaryActions.name: Attack
entries: The Asteroid Roper makes one tendril attack.

legendaryActions.name: Move
entries: The Asteroid Roper flies up to half its flying speed.

legendaryActions.name: Gravitational Surge
entries: The Asteroid Roper increases the gravitational pull for a moment. Each creature within 60 feet must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of their next turn.
Costs 2 Actions

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The morkoth casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Cosmic Resilience
entries: The Asteroid Morkoth can breathe and survive in the vacuum of space and is immune to radiation and cold.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the morkoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The morkoth makes either three Bite attacks and two Tentacles attack or 5 tentacle attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}58 ({@damage 12d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Void Stare
entries: The morkoth projects a 60-foot cone of magical energy. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition charmed} by the morkoth for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the target tries to get as close to the morkoth as possible, using its actions to {@action Dash} until it is within 5 feet of the morkoth. A {@condition charmed} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the morkoth's Hypnosis for 24 hours.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 13} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 10d6 + 2}) damage.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection
entries: If the morkoth makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, the morkoth can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 120 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the morkoth. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The morkoth makes one Bite attack.

legendary.name: Tentacles (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The morkoth makes one attack with its Tentacles.

legendary.name: Hypnosis (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The morkoth uses Hypnosis.

legendary.name: Cast Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The morkoth uses Spellcasting.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dracolisk can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dracolisk fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: If a creature starts its turn within 60 feet of the dracolisk and the two of them can see each other, the dracolisk can force the creature to make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw if the dracolisk isn't {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} until freed by the {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the dracolisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert it s eyes again. If it looks at the dracolisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the dracolisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dracolisk can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and 3 Claw attacks. it can choose to use a breath weapon instead of 1 bite or 2 claws

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d12 + 7}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 4d8}) acid damage, and tertiary damage 4 ({@damage 4d8}) poison.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 9d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dracolisk's choice that is within 120 feet of the dracolisk and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dracolisk's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Acid Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dracolisk exhales acid in a 15-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 90 ({@damage 20d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dracolisk makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dracolisk makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dracolisk beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dracolisk must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dracolisk can then fly up to half its flying speed.

monster.name: Futuristic Logistic Algorithm for Reality Enhancement - F.L.A.R.E

trait.name: Unleash
entries: At the start of initiative, Roll a {@dice d8} and apply corresponding effect.
1 - Lazer wall (Ground): Wall of lazers deals {@dice 22d12} radiant damage
2 - Fireballs (Leftmost arm): Massive fireballs deal {@dice 24d12} Fire damage
3 - Static shock (lightning arm): Lightning shock deals {@dice 27d10} lightning damage
4 - Turrets (left summon): turrets appear and shoot people with bullets of random sizes for {@dice 18d8} peircing damage, and {@dice 20d6} Bludgeoning damage.
5 - Glados releases nurotoxin - poisons people and goes through poison resistance/immunity to deal damage. {@dice 10d35} poison damage.
6 - Minecraft TNT (right summon)- Explosions around the place, everyone takes {@dice 8d52} force damage, and get pushed. Creatures in the water are also pushed to the other wall.
7 - Frost - The entire screen freezes over, everyone takes {@dice 12d33} cold damage
8 - Nuke - A massive nuke starts to drop from above {@dice 11d62} radiant or necrotic damage.
Each effect takes place 4 turns after the {@dice d8} roll. once unleashed, roll another {@dice d8}.

action.name: Summon glitches.
entries: Flare can summon 2 hero glitches using "Main character Syndrome" and 1 villan glitch using "Villan origin story". Roll a {@dice d8} for each hero and villan summon.

action.name: 1. Link (Master Sword Slash)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 7d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: 2. Mario(Fireball)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 6d10}) fire damage.

action.name: 3. Sonic(Spin Dash)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 40 ft. line. {@h}40 ({@damage 7d10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: 4. The Knight(Desolating Dive)
entries: The Knight appears and dives at a point. Creatures 100ft in either direction must make a dexterity saving throw ({@dc 27}) or take 45 ({@dice 7d12}) necrotric damage

action.name: 5. Gordon Freeman (Mini-gun)
entries: range 240 ft., 50 bullets at any number of creatures within range, max 20 bullets per creature. 2 damage per bullet, dex save {@dc 27}

action.name: 6. Master chief (Laser rifle)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 200 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 6d10}) fire damage.

action.name: 7. Bounty hunter(Dagger slash, Jinnada)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 7d8}) slashing damage, if the target has gold, 5% of the gold is removed and additional damage equal to stolen gold

action.name: 8. Doomguy (BFG 10000)
entries: Beam, 15ft high, 120ft long. Deals {@dice  10d10} damage in a line, constifution save {@dc 27} to avoid radiant damage/force damage.

action.name: 1. Bowser (stomp)
entries: 20ft radius, blud damage damage {@dice 26d6} dex save. {@dc 27}

action.name: 2. Albert Wesker(Metal infused Tentacle arm)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}63 ({@damage 14d8}) slashing damage.

action.name: 3. Dr. Eggman (Drop egg)
entries: EMP egg - Shocks creatures in a 60ft radius, Dispels spells of level 5 or lower. deals 55 ({@dice 10d10}) lightning damage.

action.name: 4. The Radiance (Homing Balls)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 90 ft., two targets. {@h}44 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage/radiant each.

action.name: 5. Glados (Portal Gun)
entries: Teleport player in 100ft range, charisma save.

action.name: 6. Vaas (drugs)
entries: Vaas appears and blows white power in a 90ft cone. creatures need to make {@dc 27} con save or paralyze.

action.name: 7. Alduin (raise 2 dragons to elemental breath)
entries: each dragon {@dice 18d6} damage 60ft cone, corresponding save.

action.name: 8. Doc Octavius(Grapple+restain 4 creatures)
entries: Creatures within 90ft make str/dex save {@dc 27}. on failure, {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}. Must use action to escape.

monster.name: Heart of Styx
resist: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The Heart of Styx's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: darkness, fear, water walk; 3/day each: circle of death, confusion, phantasmal killer; 1/day: weird.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance
entries: If the Heart of Styx fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Heart of Styx has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Amnesia Strike
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: +16 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 45 (6d10 + 9) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or lose proficiency in one skill or tool of the Heart of Styx's choice for 24 hours.

action.name: Memory Drain
entries: The Heart of Styx emits a pulse of Stygian energy in a 60-foot radius. Each creature in that area must make a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw, taking 55 (10d10) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the creature also forgets all spells and abilities they have used in the last hour. They cannot use those spells and abilities again until they finish a long rest.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Heart of Styx makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Psychic Slam
entries: Costs 2 Actions: The Heart of Styx targets one creature it can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or take 22 (4d10) psychic damage and be stunned until the end of their next turn.

legendary.name: Restore Memory
entries: Costs 3 Actions: The Heart of Styx regains spent magical energy, allowing it to immediately recharge its Memory Drain ability.

item.name: Expanded Capacity Shiftweave
entries: This Expanded Capacity Shiftweave is a magical garment capable of storing up to ten different outfits. Instead of having outfits pre-embedded at creation, this shiftweave can absorb and store any non-magical outfit it mimics. By touching an outfit and spending 1 minute concentrating, the wearer can store the outfit's design in one of the shiftweave's available slots. Stored designs can be accessed or replaced at any time.

By speaking a command word as a bonus action, the wearer can transform the shiftweave into any one of the stored outfits. The clothing cannot mimic the magical properties of other magical garments, despite being able to replicate their look.

entries.name: Chameleon
entries: While wearing the shiftweave transformed into a stored outfit, the wearer can choose to also mimic the voice and general mannerisms of the individual typically associated with the outfit. Granting advantage to deception(charisma) checks made to pass off as the individual.

entries.name: Summon Outfit
entries: As an action, the wearer can target one creature they can see within 30 feet and instantly clothe them in one of the outfits stored in the shiftweave, effectively disguising them. This transformation lasts for up to 1 hour or until the wearer dismisses it as a bonus action

item.name: Aboleth Oil
entries: A creature subjected to this oil must make a Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease, but the creature is unaware that they have been affected. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6({@dice 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.
{@b Unique Component:} An Aboleth
{@b Save DC:} 14

item.name: Black Ivy Paste (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@dice 1d6}) poison damage. The paste retains its potency until a total of at least 10 damage has been dealt.
{@b Unique Component:} Black Ivy Leaves
{@b Save DC:} 16

item.name: Black Lotus Extract (Master)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw or take 3 ({@dice 1d6}) poison damage. The paste retains its potency until a total of at least 10 damage has been dealt.
{@b Unique Component:} Black Ivy Leaves
{@b Save DC:} 16

item.name: Boneshard Paste (Proficient)
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute, also taking 18 ({@dice 4d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The creature's speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn. The poisoned creature is {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} Bones of a holy person. (Can only be purchased at a temple)
{@b Save DC:} 16

item.name: Brawler's Bourbon (Master)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
{@b Unique Component:} Bourbon Whiskey.
{@b Save DC:} 12

item.name: Chuul Paralytic
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A Chuul. (Not craftable)
{@b Save DC:} 13

item.name: Crawler Mucus
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. The poisoned creature is paralyzed. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A Carrion Crawler. (Not craftable)
{@b Save DC:} 13

item.name: Goodbye Kiss (Master)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison suffers no effect until the stroke of midnight. If the poison has not been neutralized before then, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@dice 9d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@b Unique Component:} Midnight Tears flower.
{@b Save DC:} 17

item.name: Golden Ice (Master)
entries: An evil creature that comes into contact with golden ice must make a Constitution saving throw or take 30 (12d4) cold damage. This damage bypasses all resistances and immunities.
{@b Unique Component:} True Ice.
{@b Save DC:} 17

item.name: Oil of Taggit (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 24 hours. The poisoned creature is unconscious. The creature wakes up if it takes damage.
{@b Unique Component:} None
{@b Save DC:} 13

item.name: Sunlight Oil (Proficient)
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 27 ({@dice 6d8}) radiant damage and be {@condition blinded} until the end of the beginning of your next turn (6 seconds if out of combat). On a successful save, they take half damage and are not blinded. Creatures with sunlight sensitivity have disadvantage on their saving throw.
{@b Unique Component:} Holy Oil. (Can only be purchased at a temple)
{@b Save DC:} 18

item.name: Bearded Devil Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated bearded devil.
{@b Save DC:} 12

item.name: Bloodfire Paste (Expert)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 11 ({@dice 2d10}) fire damage on a failed save, and must repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the creature takes 3 ({@dice 1d6}) fire damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends. This effect ignores a creature's immunity to poison, but cannot affect a creature without blood.
{@b Unique Component:} None
{@b Save DC:} 13

item.name: Bone Devil's Sting
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 17 ({@dice 5d6}) poison damage and become poisoned for 1 minute. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not poisoned. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated bone devil.
{@b Save DC:} 14

item.name: Celestial Essence (Proficient)
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 5 ({@dice 2d4}) radiant damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.
{@b Unique Component:} The Blood of a Living Celestial.
{@b Save DC:} 14

item.name: Centipede Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while poisoned in this way.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated giant centipede.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Cockatrice Saliva
entries: A creature subjected to this venom must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against being magically {@condition petrified}. On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. It must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends. On a failure, the creature is {@condition petrified} for 24 hours.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated cockatrice.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Drow Poison (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious} while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
{@b Unique Component:} Drow Recipe.
{@b Save DC:} 13

item.name: Elemental Contra (Master)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature loses all immunities or resistances to the poison's elemental damage type (Cold, Fire, Lightning), and gains vulnerability to that damage type. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until cured.
{@b Unique Component:} Blood of the target and Crystals from the elemental chaos.
{@b Save DC:} 25

item.name: Ettercap Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 4 (1d8) poison damage and becoming poisoned for 1 minute on a failed save. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated giant centipede. (Not craftable)
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Grell Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} creature is {@condition paralyzed}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated grell.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Imp Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated imp.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Lichbane Poison (Expert)
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, their Intellect, Wisdom, and Charisma scores are reduced by 2 for 1 minute. At the beginning of their next turn, they must repeat the saving throw. On a failure, the effect becomes permanent and can only be cured by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.
{@b Unique Component:} Residuum.
{@b Save DC:} 17

item.name: Liquid Mortality (Master)
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, their Strength score is permanently reduced by 2. If this effect reduces an undead creature's Strength to 0, they are utterly destroyed, and cannot be resurrected or reanimated by any means other than a wish spell. The creature's Strength score can be restored by a greater restoration spell or similar magic.
{@b Unique Component:} Holy oil blessed by the god of death.
{@b Save DC:} 22

item.name: Metabolite (Expert)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, an affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn. If the creature attempts to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20. On an 11 or higher, the spell doesn't take effect until the creature's next turn, and the creature must use its action on that turn to complete the spell. If it can't, the spell is wasted. A creature affected by this poison makes another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the effect ends for it. On a failed save, the poison's saving throw DC decreases by 5.
{@b Unique Component:} Blood of the target creature.
{@b Save DC:} 25

item.name: Naga Venom
entries: A creature subjected to the venom of a spirit naga must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 31 ({@dice 7d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison has been harvested from a guardian naga, this damage increases to 45 ({@dice 10d8}) and the saving throw DC increases by 2.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated naga.
{@b Save DC:} 13-15

item.name: Pit Fiend Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@conditon poisoned}. While poisoned in this way, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 21 ({@dice 6d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated pit fiend.
{@b Save DC:} 21

item.name: Pseudodragon Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated pseudodragon.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Purified Couatl Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 24 hours. Until this poison ends, the target is {@conditon unconscious}. Another creature can use an action to shake the target awake. This effect ignores immunity to the poisoned condition.
{@b Unique Component:} A willing couatl.
{@b Save DC:} 13

item.name: Purple Worm Poison
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 42 ({@dice 12d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated purple worm.
{@b Save DC:} 19

item.name: Scorpion Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@dice 1d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison has been harvested from a giant scorpion, the damage increases to 22 ({@dice 4d10}) and the saving throw DC increases by 3.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated scorpion.
{@b Save DC:} 9-12

item.name: Serpent Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 5 ({@dice 2d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison has been harvested from a giant poisonous snake, the damage increases to 10 ({@dice 3d6}) and the saving throw DC increases by 1.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated poisonous snake. (Not craftable)
{@b Save DC:} 10-11

item.name: Spider Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2 (@dice 1d4}) poison damage. If the poison has been harvested from a giant wolf spider, the damage increases to 7 ({@dice 2d6}) and the saving throw DC increases to 11. Additionally, the creature takes half damage on a failed save, and if the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while poisoned in this way. If the poison has been harvested from a giant spider, this damage increases to 9 ({@dice 2d8}).
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated spider.
{@b Save DC:} 10-11

item.name: Sprite Poison
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
{@b Unique Component:} Sprite Recipe.
{@b Save DC:} 10

item.name: Svirfneblin Poison (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} Svirfneblin Recipe.
{@b Save DC:} 12

item.name: Thri-kreen Venom
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also paralyzed while poisoned in this way. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw on each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated thri-kreen.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Wasp's Sting
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@dice 3d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated giant wasp.
{@b Save DC:} 11

item.name: Witchbane Poison (Expert)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they lose {@dice 1d4} spell slots, starting at level 1 slots and increasing until that many spell slots have been lost. This effect ignores all magical effects that grant immunity to poison.
{@b Unique Component:} Residuum.
{@b Save DC:} 17

item.name: Wyvern Poison
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@dice 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated wyvern.
{@b Save DC:} 15

item.name: Yuan-ti Venom
entries: A creature subjected to the poison from a yuan-ti malison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@dice 2d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison has been harvested from a yuan-ti abomination, the damage increases to 10 ({@dice 3d6}) and the saving throw DC increases to 13.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated yuan-ti malison or abomination.
{@b Save DC:} 11-13

item.name: Zealot's Blade (Master)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 78 ({@dice 12d12}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. This damage ignores resistances and immunities.
{@b Unique Component:} Blood of the creature's type.
{@b Save DC:} 25

item.name: Ropikai Poison
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@dice 2d6}) poison damage and be poisoned for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the creature takes 3 ({@dice 1d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns.
{@b Unique Component:} A dead or incapacitated ropikai.
{@b Save DC:} 14

item.name: Basic Aquatoxin (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@dice 1d4}) poison damage. If the affected creature has the natural ability to breath underwater, this damage increases to 5 ({@dice 2d4}) poison damage and the saving throw DC increases to 12. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.
{@b Unique Component:} Not applicable.
{@b Save DC:} 10-12

item.name: Basic Banetoxin (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 21 ({@dice 6d6}) poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying. This effect ignores all resistances and immunities.
{@b Unique Component:} Not applicable.
{@b Save DC:} 25

item.name: Basic Poison (Proficient)
entries: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 2 ({@dice 1d4}) poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.
{@b Unique Component:} Not applicable.
{@b Save DC:} 10

item.name: Basic Positoxin (Proficient)
entries: An undead creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 7 ({@ dice 2d6}) radiant damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.
{@b Unique Component:} Not applicable.
{@b Save DC:} 10

item.name: The Stack Overflow
entries: Created in the hidden digital forges of the Technomancers, The Stack Overflow is a sword of sleek, metallic design, with runes of ancient modron etched along its shimmering, spiral blade. When unsheathed, the air crackles with raw data streams, and the faint hum of binary whispers can be heard.

Attacks made with this greatsword gain an additional +3 to attack and damage rolls. Additionally, this blade does {@dice 2d10} damage instead of the weapon's normal damage dice if the target relies on magic or uses enchanted equipment.

entries.name: PixelWorld Failsafe
entries: Within PixelWorld, this blade deals an additional {@dice 2d10} failsafe damage to creations of the system.

entries.name: Codebreaker
entries: Once per day, you can cast {@spell Counterspell} as a 5th-level spell without expending a spell slot. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

entries.name: Garbage Collection
entries: When the sword strikes an undead or construct, it can instantly disintegrate targets with 64 hit points or less, clearing away the garbage with efficiency.

entries.name: Reboot
entries: Once per long rest, if you fall to 0 hit points, you can choose to 'reboot', instantly regaining 1 hit point and standing up as a burst of energy clears any non-magical restraints or conditions.

spell.name: Deep Ethereal Tunnel

components.m: a gemstone formed from the heart of a dying world, worth at least 50,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You channel destructive energy to tear the very fabric of space on a surface you touch, creating a permanent rift 10ft in radius to another plane of existence. While casting this spell, roll an ability check with your spellcasting ability. On a 20 or higher, you can choose the connecting plane. Otherwise, the plane is chosen the randomly or decided by the DM.

spell.name: Delete Fate

components.m: an object tied to the target's soul, worth at least 100,000 gp

entries: You touch a creature and erase it from existence. The target is removed from the fabric of reality, forgotten by all.

spell.name: Plane

components.m: a piece of creation or internal void energy, and a sacrifice of the caster's own life force worth 5 times thier hitpoint maximum, over the course of the period of casting.

entries: The spell creates a new, self-sustaining pocket dimension according to the caster's desires, ranging from a paradise to a fortress. This dimension is accessible only through a portal at a fixed location chosen at the time of casting. The caster can define the laws of physics, creatures, and geography within this dimension. Upon completion, the caster's life force is tied to the existence of this dimension, granting them god-like control within its bounds but also linking their life to its continuity.
